pageContext.claim: “Once every 500 tweets, you might have a mistake. Remember when they got me, when I said wiretapping, meaning ‘wiretapping’ in quotes or spying, but it was in quotes because I'm talking about the modern day version. I said, ‘They're wiretapping. They're spying on me.’ Remember how you thought that was such a terrible tweet, right? I was right. They're spying on me. They spied on me. And that's not being paranoid. That's being fact. It's now known that they spied on me. They spied on Flynn.”
pageContext.analysis: This is ridiculous. First, Trump floods his Twitter feed with false and misleading claims; it's way more than "once every 500 tweets." He has flat-out claimed -- repeatedly, and despite all evidence -- that Obama ordered a wiretap on Trump to spy on him during the 2016 campaign. Contrary to what he claims here, the spying allegation has never been proven.
